sentence.Network_cn: 他成为狂热的亲英分子。

entry.def: If you describe a non-British person as Anglophile, you mean that they admire Britain and British culture.

example.ex: ...a Shake-speare sonnet taught to him by his Anglophile uncle.
example.tran: 他那亲英的叔叔教给他的一首莎士比亚的十四行诗

means.word_mean: 1. an admirer of England and things English

auth_sentence.content: Bryson is an Anglophile who revels in the nuttiness of British icons of science.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bryson is an Anglophile who revels in the nuttiness of British icons of science.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bryson is an Anglophile who revels in the nuttiness of British icons of science.

auth_sentence.content: Eighteenth-century London may have been a musical Mecca, but its two stars were really anglophile Germans: Handel and JC Bach.

auth_sentence.content: This immigrant side buffers his mistrusted Scottish Presbyterian ancestry on the maternal side, the ultra-Anglophile Grants.
